subject: CHEMISTRY
question: 1. Boron has two stable isotopes, 10B (19%) and 11B (81%). Calculate average at.wt. of boron in the periodic table.

question: 2. In which case is the number of molecules of water maximum?

question: 3. An element, X has the following isotopic composition:  200X : 90 % 199X : 8.0 % 202X : 2.0 %  The weighted average atomic mass of the naturally -occurring element X is closest to _______.

question: 5. What mass of 95% pure CaCO 3 will be required to neutralise 50 mL of 0.5 M HCl  solution according to the following reaction?  CaCO 3(s) + 2HCl(aq) → CaCl 2(aq) + CO 2(g) + 2H 2O(l)  [Calculate upto second (2nd) place of decimal point]
